title: 109_hr4305
content: Increase in expensing under Section 179 for Gulf Opportunity Zone property. Section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the limitation for Gulf Opportunity Zone property. The dollar amount for the taxable year will be increased by the cost of qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Zone property placed in service, up to $100,000 for subsection (b)(1) and $600,000 for subsection (b)(2). The amendment to Section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code increases the limitation for Gulf Opportunity Zone property by including the cost of qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Zone property placed in service. Qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property is defined as property described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i) with most of its use in the Gulf Opportunity Zone. The amendment to Section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code increases the limitation for Gulf Opportunity Zone property by including the cost of qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Zone property placed in service. Qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property is defined as property with the original use commencing with the taxpayer on or after August 28, 2005, acquired by the taxpayer on or after the same date, and placed in service by the taxpayer on or before December 31, 2007. The term "Alternative depreciation property" excludes property described in section 168(k)(2)(D)(i). The term "Tax-exempt bond-financed property" excludes property financed with tax-exempt bond proceeds. If a taxpayer elects out for a class of property in a taxable year, this subsection does not apply to all property in that class placed in service during that year. The Gulf Opportunity Zone and Hurricane Katrina disaster area are defined for tax purposes as areas eligible for federal assistance due to Hurricane Katrina. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to property placed in service after August 28, 2005, in relation to the Gulf Opportunity Zone and Hurricane Katrina disaster area.
